primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The subversion of the 'world of the memo' (control/logic) by the 'world of the poem' (God's miraculous newness), leading to a transformed reality.

subject.identificatie: The Poem / God's Newness (represented by the 'Shoot')
tekstueel_bewijs: Poetry will break the claims of the memo.
The poem opens the future that God will work.
The shoot will override all business as usual.
A sweep of well-being that contradicts the facts on the ground.
New heavens and a new earth.
The future that God will work.
I am about to create Jerusalem as a joy.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Meek / The Poor / The Hearers
tekstueel_bewijs: He will decide with righteousness on behalf of the poor.
Invites us listeners to watch for newness.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is initially the Receiver, but is pushed toward becoming a Subject in the secondary program.

helper.identificatie: The Poets (Mothers of Israel, Prophets, John the Baptist)
tekstueel_bewijs: The poet anticipates, against all the data.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the ultimate Subject/Sender; the Poem is the instrument.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help: 'incursion of God’s spirit that will break open the cabal'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Memo / Logic / The Power Elite
tekstueel_bewijs: The cabal of the critical control.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The 'Memo' represents a totalizing ontological system of Western civilization and human autonomy that excludes the divine.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The summons to 'do the poem'—the ethical response to the eschatological promise.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Fruit worthy of repentance / Ethical action
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon moves from the indicative (what the poem does) to the imperative (do the poem).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Prophets → The Poem ← The Memo/Logic

voorbeelden_mens_subject: Adults have learned to trust reason.
We have found our way to wealth.

voorbeelden: Imagine if the poem is true.
The earth will be full of the knowledge of the Lord.
In poetry we can do things not permitted by logic.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on a shift in perception (Knowing/Imagining) as the catalyst for transformation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Memo) to S1 (Poem), then warns against ~S1 (Entitlement) to reach a synthesis of S1 and ~S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Child' who embodies the Poem and demands a 'leap' (obedience).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'Memo' is portrayed as a soul-crushing global system.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there is a strong ethical summons, the 'engine' of the sermon is the agency of the 'Poem' (God's Word) which does what logic cannot. The indicative precedes the imperative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Be a carrier of wisdom... watch for the poor.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the New
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The future that God will work.
The cabal of the critical control.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical mothers and prophets are used as models of 'doing poetry' rather than 'writing memos'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God used these women to break the memo-system (Theocentric).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from security in logic to a vulnerable hope in the 'impossible'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is an act of 'hosting' a reality one did not create.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Poem' as a gift to the 'Poem' as a summons is handled via the figure of John the Baptist.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'receiving the impossible' to 'daily obedience' creates a slight modal tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The shoot will override all business as usual... break the monopoly.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Shoot' with wisdom and power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is the 'poison' in the world and the 'memo' of control.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions the 'Poem' (Divine Word) as the Subject that defeats the 'Memo' (Human Autonomy).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel they must 'do' the poem by their own power in the final section.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the 'Stump' out of which God brings the 'Shoot'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'fruit' is grown by the Spirit, not manufactured by the 'Adult'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly state that the Child gives the power (Pouvoir) to walk with the wolf.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The 'Memo' is a brilliant actantial opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using narrative structure to subvert humanistic self-reliance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Poem vs Memo' metaphor; Greimas shows that the 'Poem' is actually the Subject/Hero of the story.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 11; Greimas explains how the sermon uses Isaiah 11 to re-order the hearer's world.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Memo' is not just a theme but a functional Opponent that must be 'beheaded' by the 'Poem'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-Switch' where the hearer is invited to stop being the Subject of 'Control' and become the Receiver of 'Poetry'.
